channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Severe and persistent littering and waste accumulation along Camberwell Road to East Street, Walworth RoadThe stretch of Camberwell Road from the area near the Islamic centre all the way down to Morrisons on East Street, Walworth Road, is in an ongoing and unacceptable state of filth. The pavement and roadside are covered with litter including lager cans, bottles, food waste, tissues, and general debris. There are numerous large bags of rubbish left along the route—some torn open with their contents spilled across the ground, others stacked on top of one another and left for extended periods. There is also visible human waste along this road, which presents a serious public health concern. Much of the litter appears to be embedded into the pavement, which is itself heavily covered in chewing gum, making the area look permanently dirty and neglected. This situation has persisted for many months with no noticeable improvement. It is a disgusting sight, particularly on a busy route used daily by residents, families, and shoppers, and requires urgent and sustained action., 31st January
item.description:
The stretch of Camberwell Road from the area near the Islamic centre all the way down to Morrisons on East Street, Walworth Road, is in an ongoing and unacceptable state of filth. The pavement and roadside are covered with litter including lager cans, bottles, food waste, tissues, and general debris. There are numerous large bags of rubbish left along the route - some torn open with their contents spilled across the ground, others stacked on top of one another and left for extended periods. There is also visible human waste along this road, which presents a serious public health concern. Much of the litter appears to be embedded into the pavement, which is itself heavily covered in chewing gum, making the area look permanently dirty and neglected. This situation has persisted for many months with no noticeable improvement. It is a disgusting sight, particularly on a busy route used daily by residents, families, and shoppers, and requires urgent and sustained action. I am not interested in generic assurances about Southwark cleaning schedules or selective statistics. The reality on the ground is that this area is consistently filthy, and this is a regular and ongoing occurrence. The experience of walking along these streets is unpleasant and, at times, degrading due to the level of litter, waste, and neglect. Residents pay council tax and are entitled to live in areas that are properly and routinely cleaned and maintained. The current condition of this road falls well below an acceptable standard and reflects a failure to deliver basic public services. This situation requires meaningful, sustained action rather than explanations that do not align with what residents experience daily. The condition of the area is so unpleasant that taking photographic evidence is genuinely distressing. I have taken photographs in the past to document the problem, but the level of filth (including waste and debris) makes it difficult and unacceptable to repeatedly do so.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Camberwell Road, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 58 Glengall Rd, 31st January
item.description:
I am writing to report temporary roadwork barriers that have been left on the pavement outside a residential property and are causing an obstruction to the public footway. The barriers appear to be unattended and are restricting access along the pavement, creating difficulty for pedestrians, pushchairs, wheelchair users, and anyone with mobility issues. I have attached a photograph showing the issue. Could you please arrange for these barriers to be collected or repositioned as soon as possible to ensure the pavement is clear and safe to use? They are also barriers on the other side of the road that need removing. Thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glengall Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Re reporting no litter bin emptying, 31st January
item.description:
Once again the litter bins at the end of Manor Way/Kelsey Park are not emptied..Friday30th ahead of weekend !! When Harris academy pupils make their way home the bins overflow..dog waste, general litter...on both sides of road! WE NEED BIGGER LITTER BINS !
